thread.title: Amazon Expands Prime Now Service to Include Food Delivery - Yahoo Finance
thread.title_full: Amazon Expands Prime Now Service to Include Food Delivery - Yahoo Finance

author: Puneet Sikka
title: Amazon Expands Prime Now Service to Include Food Delivery - Yahoo Finance
text:
An Analysis of What Amazon's 3Q15 Could Look Like 
( Continued from Prior Part )
Amazon enters the online food delivery market In the previous part of the series, we discussed how Amazon (AMZN) continues to expand its Prime Now service. The company has now expanded this service to include online food delivery. According to a report from The Wall Street Journal , the company will rely on its contractors and employees to deliver hot food to its customers by means of cars and bicycles.
This move from Amazon will create competitive issues for the leader in the online food delivery market, GrubHub (GRUB). GrubHub has been trying to grow in this market by acquiring smaller companies in this space. It acquired leading online food aggregator Seamless in 2013, and then more recently acquired smaller companies such as DiningIn and Restaurants on the Run.

Amazon looking to tap into the huge food retail market Amazon already offers its AmazonFresh service for delivering groceries in select cities in the United States. Through these initiatives, Amazon is clearly looking to leverage the huge US food retail market. According to a report from Euromonitor International and as the chart above shows, Walmart (WMT) and Kroger (KR) lead the US grocery retail market with shares of 20% and 8%, respectively.
For diversified exposure to Walmart, you can invest in the Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR (XLP), which invests about 6% of its holdings in Walmart.
